definitions.definition: Hell ; the bottomless pit ; primeval chaos ; a confined subterranean ocean.
A bottomless or unfathomed depth, gulf, or chasm ; hence, any deep, immeasurable ; any void space.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 16 century.
First attested in the late 16 century.

definitions.definition: Moral depravity ; vast intellectual or moral depth.
examples: They fell into the abyss of drug addiction.

definitions.definition: The center of an escutcheon ; fess point .
A difference, especially a large difference, between groups.

main_definition: Hell ; the bottomless pit ; primeval chaos ; a confined subterranean ocean. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
secondary_definitions: ( frequently figurative ) A bottomless or unfathomed depth, gulf, or chasm ; hence, any deep, immeasurable ; any void space. [First attested in the late 16 century.]
Anything infinite , immeasurable, or profound . [First attested in the late 16 century.]
Moral depravity ; vast intellectual or moral depth.
( with article ) An impending catastrophic happening .
( heraldry ) The center of an escutcheon ; fess point .
( figurative ) A difference, especially a large difference, between groups.
